name: Mini Class on Higgs Discovery
tagline: Mini class at the NYU Physics Department for Spring 2014 about the Higgs Boson discovery.
body:
## Aims and scope

Hands-on with the Higgs Discovery. Understand the experimental effort and challenges on the theory side. Familiarize with techniques that are used to _claim a discovery_ and what it means to _measure_ the Higgs mass or couplings.

__Audience__: For Freshmen and Juniors. Knowledge of Freshmen Physics, introductory Quantum Mechanics but no Quantum Field Theory or Particle Physics knowledge is expected.


## Contact

Sven Kreiss, <sk@svenkreiss.com>


## Course Material

There are no books required for this class. Some material and links will appear under the link _View On GitHub_ on the left.
 

## Topics and Schedule

Classes are scheduled for __Mondays at 2pm in the CCPP lounge__ (Meyer building, 5th floor).

1. __February 3__: CERN, LHC, ATLAS, CMS, Geneva. Big Science.  
Introduction to Particle Physics.

2. __February 10__: Theories of nature with symmetry. Fields and interactions. Particle detectors and data acquisition.  
.  
__No class on February 17__.

3. __February 24__: Particle masses. The Higgs boson and electroweak symmetry breaking. Hadron colliders. Higgs production modes and decay channels.

4. __March 3__: Simulating the LHC. Statistical modeling to test the Higgs hypothesis. Understand LHC results. Discovery. Properties.

5. (March 10) 



## Credits and Assessments

This is a zero credit course and there are no exams or written tests.
